info.document:
Editor: Paul Grant         + 1 202 898 8322
Picture Desk: Singapore         + 65 6870 3775
Graphics queries:                + 65 6870 3595

(All times GMT/ET)
TOP STORIES
United States says North Korea endangers whole world after
missile test
SEOUL/WASHINGTON - U.S. Secretary of State Rex Tillerson
accuses North Korea of threatening entire world, after Pyongyang
fires missile over Japan for second time in under a month in
defiance of international pressure over its missile and nuclear
programs. (NORTHKOREA-MISSILES/ (WRAPUP 8, PIX, TV, GRAPHIC),
expect by 1900 GMT/3 PM ET, by Jack Kim and Susan Heavey, 900
words)

Home-made bomb injures 22 on packed London commuter train
LONDON - Home-made bomb on packed rush-hour commuter train
in London engulfs carriage in flames and injures 22 people in
Britain's fifth major terrorism incident this year, but
apparently fails to fully explode. (BRITAIN-SECURITY/LONDON
(UPDATE 8, PIX, TV), moved, by Kevin Coombs and Yann Tessier,
888 words)
+ See also:
- BRITAIN-SECURITY/MAY-TRUMP (UPDATE 1), moved, 266 words
- BRITAIN-SECURITY/USA, moved, 220 words

Nearly 2 million, mostly in Florida, without power in Irma's
wake
MIAMI - About 1.9 million homes and businesses in Florida,
Georgia and Carolinas remain without power from Hurricane Irma,
five days after deadly storm rips through U.S. Southeast.
(STORM-IRMA/ (UPDATE 1, PIX, TV), moved, by Zachary Fagenson,
475 words)


UNITED STATES
Hurricane Harvey slams U.S. retail sales, industrial output
WASHINGTON - U.S. retail sales unexpectedly fall and
industrial output records its biggest drop since 2009 as
Hurricane Harvey disrupts activity, suggesting storm could dent
economic growth. (USA-ECONOMY/ (WRAPUP 3, PIX), moved, by Lucia
Mutikani, 760 words)
U.S. Sen. Warren introduces Equifax bill, launches industry
probe
WASHINGTON - U.S. Sen. Elizabeth Warren says she has begins
investigation of Equifax's massive data breach and, along with
11 other Democratic senators, introduces bill to give consumers
ability to freeze their credit for free. (EQUIFAX-CYBER/WARREN
(UPDATE 1, PIX), moved, by Chris Sanders and Michelle Price, 646
words)

Pastors stand firm as Trump's U.S. evangelical base weakens
WASHINGTON - New Reuters/Ipsos poll shows that President
Donald Trump's popularity among white evangelicals weakens,
suggesting his grassroots support may not be unconditional.
(USA-TRUMP/EVANGELICALS (GRAPHIC, TV, PIX), moved, by Ayesha
Rascoe and Chris Kahn, 960 words)

Harvard withdraws fellowship invitation to Chelsea Manning
Harvard University withdraws fellowship invitation to
Chelsea Manning, U.S. Army soldier who was convicted of leaking
classified data, after two leaders in U.S. intelligence
community distances themselves from school. (USA-HARVARD/
(UPDATE 2, TV), moved, by Brendan O'Brien, 287 words)

Protesters pour into St Louis streets after murder acquittal
for ex-cop
ST. LOUIS - Missouri judge rules white former St. Louis
police officer is not guilty of murder in 2011 shooting of black
man, sending hundreds of protesters to city's streets to voice
their anger. (MISSOURI-CRIME/ (UPDATE 6, PIX, TV), expect by
2000/4 PM ET, by Valerie Volcovici and Kenny Bahr, 700 words)


MIDDLE EAST
Turkey, Iran and Russia to deploy observers around Syria's
Idlib
ANKARA/ASTANA - Russia, Iran and Turkey will post observers
on edge of de-escalation zone in northern Syria's Idlib region
largely controlled by Islamist militants, three nations say.
(MIDEAST-CRISIS/SYRIA-TURKEY-MINISTRY (UPDATE 3, PIX), moved, by
Ece Toksabay and Raushan Nurshayeva, 564 words)


SPACE
Cassini spacecraft ends 13-year odyssey with fiery plunge
into Saturn
U.S. space agency NASA receives final signal from its
Cassini spacecraft as it ends ground-breaking, 13-year Saturn
mission with meteor-like plunge into ringed planet's atmosphere.
(SPACE-SATURN/CASSINI (UPDATE 3, PIX, TV), moved, by Ian
Simpson, 499 words)
